alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 13 at 3:35AM PDT until March 13 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 7 inches mainly along and near the crest. Elsewhere, as high as 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph late morning to mid afternoon. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From 11 AM this morning to 11 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and difficult travel. The hazardous conditions could impact the commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS..Snow levels will be above 4500 feet through morning and then lower this afternoon with a cold front. Snow levels will become 3000-4000 ft by 5 PM. Most of the travel impacts over the passes will occur this afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
